intro: Calandrinia gayana var. acuta, commonly known as the sharpleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Calandrinia gayana var. acuta is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
